title: Poster, "Taking Things Apart and Putting Things Together, for the American Chemical Association", 1976
title_raw: Taking Things Apart and Putting Things Together, for the American Chemical Association
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: Imprinted in green lower left on edge: Design: Chermayeff & Geismar Associates
inscribed:
In light blue upper right center in threee columns: Taking / Things / Apart / and / Putting / Things / Together 
what chemistry is / what chemists do / and what the results / have been / sponsored by the / American Chemical / Society / on the occasion / of its 10th / anniversary
Union Carbide / 270 Park Ave. / New York, N.Y. 10017 / April 5- May 28, 1976 / 9:30 - 4:30 weekdays / Closed April 16,17 / and Sundays / Admission: free
provenance: Dan Friedman; Ken Friedman; 1997: acquired by Museum
description: The poster design presents on an angle across the lower portion of the sheet, the title, Taking Things Apart and Putting Things Together, in white and green letters in a variety of san serif fonts and wiht irregular spacing. Below specific letters, printed very small in green are the names of elements.  At upper right center in light blue are three columns od text giving title, sponsor and date and place of exhibition.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Taking Things Apart and Putting Things Together, for the American Chemical Association", 1976. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-225.
